posts.content:
We've just started stocking the full range of Halso Oils, specially engineered with a high ZDDP (ZincDiakylDithioPhosphate) content with reduces wear in an Air-cooled engine. As specified by several well known engine builders. The prices should be fairly competitive and I'm looking at postage costs, but pm me if you're interested and we'll try to find an inexpensive way of getting it to you.

Steve

According to the blurb, 10w30 for "standard" oil filtration systems 15w40 for "non standard" oil filtration systems ( both are mineral oils ) and 10w40 semi synthetic for high performance and stroker engines....
Hi Steve - is a remote oil filter a non standard filtration system, bearing in mind the OG was an oil strainer ?

JonnyCJ wrote:Hi Steve - is a remote oil filter a non standard filtration system, bearing in mind the OG was an oil strainer ?
As I understand it, yes.

That's what I have and Harry Harpics recommended and fitted the 15w40 so that is what I'm using.

Hope this helps but please do your own research so that you're happy

Cheers

Steve

JonnyCJ wrote:I have and I am !
Great!

I've done a bit of research and it seems to be that the ZDDP content is the bit that makes the difference.

You have a pm btw!

Cheers

Hi all

I've now calculated packaging and UK mainland delivery costs.

1 can (1 x 5L) £6.95
2 cans (2 x 5L) £8.95

Steve

I've just sent of the first consignment to JonnyCJ so thanks for that Jonny

Anymore for any more?

I just found this if anyone's interested in a bit of light reading…..

Multi-grade Vs Mono-grade

Single-grade engine oils, such as SAE 30, were formerly recommended for use in Air-cooled VW engines because of the unreliable quality of the then available multi-grade engine oils. The new high standard for engine oils (set in the US by the American Petroleum Institute - API) has made multi-grade oils suitable for use in the VW engine.

The main issue with using a Mono-grade Oil of 30 weight, is the fact that at starting temperatures, the oil is too viscous to move freely around the oil galleries of the engine and this lack of protection on starting causes premature component wear and therefore, higher maintenance costs and time.
With a multi-grade oils, such as 10w30, 10w40 AND 15w40, the engine is more effectively lubricated from cold start and therefore gives much better protection of the internal components.

What is ZDDP and Why is it important to my VW Air-cooled Engine?

ZDDP (Zinc DiakylDithioPhosphates), or Zinc for short, is the Lubrication additive that has been proven to protect the internal components of an engine from wear. Many lubrication manufacturers refuse to publish the ppm (parts per million) rate within their oils, as they are far too low to have any effect. We do publish our rates and they range from 1200ppm for our standard oil, to a massive 1600ppm in our performance 10w40 Semi-synthetic.
When should I change my oil?

HALSO Lubricants recommend that you change you oil in your VW Air-cooled engine every 3,000 miles, or under, to keep your engine and components in optimum condition.

Steve
Thanks Steve - will be handy to keep on the shelf for my annual oil changes.

No worries.

I also read somewhere that the reason the more modern oils have a low zinc content is that it damages the catalytic converters, which we do not have to worry about

Steve
Arrived swiftly and safely this morning Steve - many thanks !

Another consignment winging it's way to Matt (c19mat)

Any more for any more?
How much for 5lit, Inc postage to Norwich? U except PayPal?

Hi Arizona

10w30 and 15w40

£23.95 + £6.95 = £30.90

PM me to arrange/discuss further?

Cheers
